definitions.text: a heading that names a statute or legislative bill; may give a brief summary of the matters it deals with
examples: Title 8 provided federal help for schools

definitions.text: the name of a work of art or literary composition etc.
examples: he looked for books with the word `jazz' in the title
he refused to give titles to his paintings
I can never remember movie titles

definitions.text: a general or descriptive heading for a section of a written work
the status of being a champion
examples: he held the title for two years

definitions.text: a legal document signed and sealed and delivered to effect a transfer of property and to show the legal right to possess it
examples: he kept the title to his car in the glove compartment

definitions.text: an identifying appellation signifying status or function: e.g. `Mr.' or `General'
examples: the professor didn't like his friends to use his formal title
a strong legal claim to the property
he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate

definitions.text: (usually plural) written material introduced into a movie or TV show to give credits or represent dialogue or explain an action
examples: the titles go by faster than I can read
`your majesty' is the appropriate title to use in addressing a king
They styled their nation `The Confederate States'
